verses.text: 天國裡誰最大那時，門徒前來問耶穌：「天國裡誰是最大的呢？」

words.note: Refers to God's reign and spiritual realm.
Specifically refers to followers of a religious leader or teacher.
Indicates possession or modifies a noun.
Used to form questions or indicate a pause.

verses.text: 耶穌叫了一個小孩子站在他們當中，說：

words.note: Indicates completion of an action.
General measure word for people or objects.

verses.text: 「我實在告訴你們，如果你們不回轉，變成像小孩子一樣，一定不能進天國。

words.note: Often implies spiritual repentance in biblical contexts.
Often used as 'A 跟 B 一樣' (A is like B).

verses.text: 所以，凡謙卑像這小孩子的，他在天國裡是最大的。

breakdown.m: by means of, so as to

words.note: Used to introduce a generalization or universal condition.
Often used in a spiritual or moral sense.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun.

verses.text: 凡因我的名接待一個這樣的小孩子的，就是接待我；

words.note: Used to introduce a generalization or universal condition.
Indicates possession or modifies a noun.
In biblical context, 'in my name' means 'for my sake' or 'by my authority'.
General measure word for people or objects.
Links an adjective/phrase to a noun.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun.
Indicates a consequence or logical connection.

verses.text: 但無論誰使一個信我的小弟兄犯罪，倒不如拿一塊大磨石拴在他的頸項上，把他沉在深海裡。

words.note: Refers to a humble believer.
Literally 'commit crime', contextually 'commit sin' or 'cause to stumble'.
A large stone used for grinding grain, often very heavy.

verses.text: 堅拒使人犯罪「這世界有禍了，因為充滿使人犯罪的事。這些事是免不了的，但那使人犯罪的有禍了！

words.note: Here nominalizes the preceding adjective phrase.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase to mean 'the one who...'

verses.text: 如果你的一隻手或一隻腳使你犯罪，就把它砍下來丟掉；你一隻手或一隻腳進永生，總比有兩隻手或兩隻腳被投進永火裡好。
如果你的一隻眼睛使你犯罪，就把它挖出來丟掉；你一隻眼睛進永生，總比有兩隻眼睛被投進地獄的火裡好。
迷羊的比喻「你們要小心，不要輕視這些小弟兄中的一個。我告訴你們，他們的使者在天上，常常見到我天父的面。

words.note: Refers to humble believers.

verses.text: （有些抄本有第11節：「人子來，是要拯救失喪的人。」）
你們認為怎樣？有一個人，他有一百隻羊，如果失了一隻，他會不把九十九隻留在山上，去尋找那迷失的嗎？

words.note: Refers to being lost or led astray, often spiritually.

verses.text: 我實在告訴你們，他若找到了，就為這一隻羊歡喜，勝過為那九十九隻沒有迷失的。

words.note: Refers to being lost or led astray, often spiritually.

verses.text: 照樣，你們在天上的父是不願意這些小弟兄中有一個失喪的。

words.note: Often refers to God's dwelling place.
Refers to God as the heavenly Father.
Refers to fellow believers or the humble.
Refers to being spiritually lost.

verses.text: 怎樣對待犯了罪的弟兄「如果你的弟兄犯了罪（「犯了罪」有些抄本作「得罪你」），你趁著和他單獨在一起的時候，要去指出他的過失來。如果他肯聽，你就得著你的弟兄。

words.note: A common phrase for 'to sin'.
Often refers to fellow believers.
Often refers to fellow believers.
A common phrase for 'to sin'.
Often implies gaining or saving in a spiritual sense.
Often refers to fellow believers.

verses.text: 如果他不肯聽，就另外帶一兩個人同去，好使一切話，憑兩三個證人的口，可以確定。

words.note: Refers to verbal testimony or word of mouth.

verses.text: 如果他再不聽，就告訴教會；如果連教會他也不聽，就把他看作教外人和稅吏吧。

words.note: Refers to non-believers, non-Jews.
Often viewed as sinners in biblical times.
Indicates suggestion or mild command.

verses.text: 「我實在告訴你們，你們在地上捆綁的，在天上也被捆綁；你們在地上釋放的，在天上也被釋放。

words.note: Figurative meaning of prohibiting or forbidding.
Figurative meaning of permitting or allowing.

verses.text: 我又告訴你們，你們當中若有兩個人，在地上同心為甚麼事祈求，我在天上的父必為他們成全。

words.note: Lit. 'same heart'; means to be in agreement.
Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 因為無論在哪裡，有兩三個人奉我的名聚會，我就在他們中間。」

words.definition: in the name of, by order of

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to authority or character.

verses.text: 不饒恕人的也得不著饒恕那時，彼得前來問耶穌：「主啊，如果我的弟兄得罪我，我要饒恕他多少次？七次嗎？」

words.note: A formal term for forgiveness.
Here nominalizes '不饒恕人' to 'those who do not forgive'.
'著' (zháo) as a resultative complement indicates success.
Here used as a noun, 'forgiveness'.
Can refer to a spiritual brother or fellow believer.

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「我告訴你，不是七次，而是七十七次（「七十七次」或譯：「七十個七次」）。

words.note: Refers to a biblical idiom, 'seventy times seven'.

verses.text: 因此，天國好像一個王，要和他的僕人算帳，
剛算的時候，有人帶了一個欠下六千萬銀幣的人來。

words.note: Refers to a large sum, likely a talent in biblical context.

verses.text: 他沒有錢償還，主人就下令叫人把他和他的妻子兒女，以及一切所有的都賣掉，用來償還。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.

words.definition: used for, for the purpose of

verses.text: 那僕人就跪下拜他，說：『請寬容我，我會把一切還給你的。』

words.note: A key character role in parables.
Literally 'broad tolerance'.

verses.text: 主人動了慈心，把那僕人放了，並且免了他的債。

words.note: A key character role in parables.
Literally 'compassionate heart'.
A central theme in this parable.

verses.text: 那僕人出來，遇見一個欠了他一百個銀幣的僕人，就抓住他，扼著他的喉嚨，說：『把你欠我的錢還給我。』

words.note: Refers to historical currency in biblical times.

verses.text: 那和他一同作僕人的就跪下求他，說：『請寬容我，我會還給你的。』

words.note: Literally 'broad tolerance'.

verses.text: 他卻不肯，反而把他帶走，關在監裡，等他把所欠的還清。

words.note: Nominalizes the following verb/phrase.

verses.text: 其他的僕人看見這事，非常難過，就去向主人報告這一切事情。

words.note: Lit. 'not ordinary'.
Lit. 'difficult to pass/endure'.

verses.text: 於是主人叫他來，對他說：『你這個惡僕，你求我，我就免了你欠我的一切。
難道你不應該憐憫你的同伴，好像我憐憫你一樣嗎？』

words.note: Implies 'could it be that...?' or 'don't tell me...?'

verses.text: 於是主人大怒，把他送去服刑，等他把所欠的一切還清。

words.note: Indicates object is disposed of or acted upon.
Indicates object is disposed of or acted upon.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb or verb phrase.

verses.text: 如果你們各人不從心裡饒恕你的弟兄，我的天父也必這樣待你們。」

words.note: Refers to a spiritual brother or fellow believer in biblical context.
